content: In the following questions, I will provide a target Python program code. The code is a program containing a loop, and the purpose of the code is indicated by its function name. Please provide a loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the loop to prove the partial correctness of the program. The loop invariant should be written in the form 'xxx_value = fun(arr[xxx]->arr[xxx])'. (Please note that your answer should only contain statements in the specified format without any additional text.)

def give_last(arr):
    last_value = arr[0]
    i = 0
    while i < len(arr):
        last_value = arr[i]
        i += 1
    return last_value

The loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the loop in the provided program is:


```less
last_value_i = give_last(arr[i])
```
This invariant ensures that the value of `last_value` at each iteration is the result of applying `give_last` function to the current element of the array `arr` at that iteration. This invariant proves the partial correctness of the program because it ensures that the loop body is executed correctly and that the last value of the array is obtained at the end of the loop.

def give_first(arr):
    first_value = arr[-1]
    i = len(arr)
    while i > 0:
        i -= 1
        first_value = arr[i]
    return first_value

The loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the loop in the provided program is:


```less
first_value_i = give_first(arr[i])
```
This invariant ensures that the value of `first_value` at each iteration is the result of applying `give_first` function to the last element of the array `arr` at that iteration. It also ensures that the loop body is executed correctly and that the first value of the array is obtained at the end of the loop.
